thread.title: Kym Marsh DENIES ‘angry meltdown’ in London hotel when staff didn't recognise her
thread.title_full: Kym Marsh DENIES ‘angry meltdown’ in London hotel when staff didn't recognise her

author: Jessica Gibb
title: Kym Marsh DENIES ‘angry meltdown’ in London hotel when staff didn't recognise her
text:
Kym Marsh DENIES ‘angry meltdown’ in London hotel when staff didn't recognise her Coronation Street actress insists she wasn’t a diva after NTAs Share Get soaps updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Kym Marsh has taken to Twitter to deny that she had a “meltdown” in a London hotel. 
It was reported that Kym got into a “heated argument” with hotel staff at London’s InterContinental Hotel after the National Television Awards last week. 
The Coronation Street actress was reportedly left distraught after her door key wouldn’t work and staff asked her to show her ID. Read More Kym Marsh denied being a diva (Photo: WENN.com) 
“Don’t you know who I am?” Kym was reported to have said by The Sun . 
But Kym has now taken to Twitter to strongly deny any diva behaviour. 
“Just read I had a meltdown over a hotel room key,” she tweeted to her 715k followers. 
“And as if I'd ever say 'don't you know who I am?' You have to laugh at the stuff they make up.” Kym Marsh denied having a meltdown (Photo: Kym Marsh/Twitter) 
The meltdown was said to have happened on the night of the NTAs last week. 
Kym joined her Corrie co-stars at the awards but their soap lost out to Emmerdale for the Best Serial Drama award. 
But a source said that Kym was merely “frustrated” as she was unable to provide staff with ID as it was locked in her room. Kym Marsh insists she was well behaved (Photo: WENN.com) Kym Marsh with Corrie co-star Simon Gregson (Photo: WENN.com) 
“The staff said they couldn't help her - which you can imagine was very frustrating,” a source told MailOnline . 
“In the end Kym called someone from ITV who came and sorted it out for her. Kym didn't lose her temper at all or say ‘do you know who I am?’ After half an hour or so it all got sorted out. That was all there was to it.” 
Mirror Online have contacted Kym’s representative for comment. Like us on Facebook
